SEARCH
Package classifiers

Class KMeansClassifier

java.lang.Object
classifiers.KMeansClassifier
public class KMeansClassifier extends Object
The KMeansClassifier class implements the K-means clustering algorithm to create clusters of similar samples. It is used to partition a dataset into a specified number of clusters.

Although KMeans is an unsupervised algorithm, we can still use it as a classifier with a labeled dataset.

Author:
[Kentaro Sauce]

    The Cluster class represents a cluster formed by the K-means algorithm.

  • Constructor Details

    • KMeansClassifier

      public KMeansClassifier(int k, List<Sample> dataSet, boolean usingPP, int maxIterations, int distanceNorm, int randomSeed)
      Constructs a KMeansClassifier object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      k - Number of clusters to form.
      dataSet - List of samples representing the dataset.
      usingPP - Whether to initialize centroids using k-means++.
      maxIterations - Maximum number of iterations for the algorithm.
      distanceNorm - Order of the Minkowski norm for distance calculation.
      randomSeed - Seed for all RNG in the algorithm.

    • KMeansClassifier

      public KMeansClassifier(int k, List<Sample> dataSet, boolean usingPP, int maxIterations, int distanceNorm)
      Constructs a KMeansClassifier object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      k - Number of clusters to form.
      dataSet - List of samples representing the dataset.
      usingPP - Whether to initialize centroids using k-means++.
      maxIterations - Maximum number of iterations for the algorithm.
      distanceNorm - Order of the Minkowski norm for distance calculation.

  • Method Details

    • runKMeans

      public void runKMeans()
      Runs the K-means clustering algorithm.

    • initializeClusters

      private void initializeClusters()
      Initializes the clusters based on the initialization strategy.

    • initializeClustersRandom

      private void initializeClustersRandom()
      Initializes clusters randomly by selecting k random samples as initial centroids.

    • initializeClustersKMeansPlusPlus

      private void initializeClustersKMeansPlusPlus()
      Initializes clusters using the k-means++ strategy.

    • calculateDistancesToNearestCentroids

      private List<Double> calculateDistancesToNearestCentroids()
      Calculates distances from each sample to its nearest cluster centroid. Used by initializeClustersKMeansPlusPlus().
      Returns:
      List of distances to nearest centroids.

    • calculateMinimumDistanceToClusters

      private double calculateMinimumDistanceToClusters(Sample sample)
      Calculates the minimum distance from a sample to the existing cluster centroids. Used by calculateDistancesToNearestCentroids() for initializeClustersKMeansPlusPlus().
      Parameters:
      sample - The sample to calculate distances for.
      Returns:
      Minimum distance to existing centroids.

    • addClusterBasedOnProbability

      private void addClusterBasedOnProbability(List<Double> distances, double randomValue)
      Adds a cluster based on a probability distribution determined by distances.
      Parameters:
      distances - List of distances to nearest centroids.
      randomValue - Random value used for probability calculation.

    • assignSamplesToClusters

      private void assignSamplesToClusters()
      Assigns each sample to its nearest cluster.

    • findNearestCluster

      private KMeansClassifier.Cluster findNearestCluster(Sample sample)
      Finds the nearest cluster for a given sample.
      Parameters:
      sample - The sample to find the nearest cluster for.
      Returns:
      The nearest cluster.

    • updateCentroids

      private void updateCentroids()
      Updates the centroids of all clusters.

    • areAllClustersConverged

      private boolean areAllClustersConverged()
      Checks if all clusters have converged to their last state.
      Returns:
      True if all clusters have converged, false otherwise.

    • printClusters

      public void printClusters(int iteration, List<KMeansClassifier.Cluster> clusters)
      Prints information about the clusters including the centroid coordinates and the labels of the samples corresponding to them.
      Parameters:
      iteration - The current iteration number.
      clusters - List of clusters to print.

    • printClusterLabels

      public void printClusterLabels(int iteration, List<KMeansClassifier.Cluster> clusters)
      Prints the label of each sample corresponding to the clusters.
      Parameters:
      iteration - The current iteration number.
      clusters - List of clusters to print.

    • getMethodName

      private String getMethodName()
      Gets the method name used to generate the current dataset based on the number of features in the dataset.
      Returns:
      A string representing the method name.

    • assignClusterLabels

      public void assignClusterLabels()
      Assigns cluster labels based on the most frequent label in each cluster.

    • computeConfusionMatrix

      private void computeConfusionMatrix()
      Computes the confusion matrix for the classification results after assigning labels to the clusters.

    • computeEvaluationScores

      public void computeEvaluationScores()
      Computes precision, recall, and F1 scores for each class and calculates the macro F1 score of the model.

    • printEvaluations

      public void printEvaluations()
      Prints the evaluation metrics for each class and the macro F1 score in % format, before ultimately printing the confusion matrix. 'P' corresponds to the precision value, 'R' corresponds to the recall value and 'F' corresponds to the F1 score.
